intro: Uragoga anamallayana, commonly known as the Anamallaya uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found growing in shaded, moist forest environments. It is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Ayurvedic practices. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
